    Short Installation Instructions

    installation.Rmd

    Installation of the R packages

    In order to use UQSA you (obviously) need the R language (and maybe a graphical interface to it like R-studio). With this you can run most of our examples by installing the following packages:

    # requires the 'remotes' package
if (!require(remotes)) install.packages(remotes)
remotes::install_github("icpm-kth/SBtabVFGEN",dependencies=TRUE)
remotes::install_github("icpm-kth/rgsl",dependencies=TRUE)
remotes::install_github("icpm-kth/uqsa",dependencies=TRUE)

    To also build your own model from SBtab files you need a few external programs and one additional R package.

    Model building

    The model building part of UQSA (transfering the SBtab network model to a mathematical model in C or R) requires that you have a C compiler (e.g.Â gcc), the GNU Scientific Library (gsl) and pkg-config. These can be installed all at once with the following command (that you have to write in the terminal window of your computer).

    In macOS:

    # macOS has a lot of issues with xcode, it loves it for some reason; maybe agree to xcode license
brew install pkg-config gcc gsl

    In linux (ubuntu/debian):

    # other linux distributions have some version of this:
#  zypper install,
#  apk add,
#  guix install,
# etc.
sudo apt install pkg-config gcc libgsl-dev

    Model building also requires an additional R package (to be installed in R) based on yacas:

    install.packages("Ryacas")

    MPI

    If you want to run on several nodes of a cluster via MPI (debian/ubuntu):

    sudo apt install libopenmpi-dev

    and in R:

    install.packages("pbdMPI")

    On other systems, install the equivalent package for OpenMPI and pbdMPI (R package interfacing with MPI libraries on your system).

    On this page
